metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5522 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the ParseValue function in lexer.c in tidy before 4.9.31 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors involving a command character in an href.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtidy-0.99-0 - 20091223cvs-1.2ubuntu1.1
tidy - 20091223cvs-1.2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tidy package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20091223cvs-1.2ubuntu1.1').
